item.title: Openvibe combines Mastodon, Bluesky and Nostr into one social app
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
Ahead of these potential competitors comes Openvibe, a simple aggregator for the open social web.

Welcome to TechCrunch Fintech! Last week was a holiday in the United States, so news was a bit lighter than normal. But there was still fintech-related items to report, including the ongoing drama around Synapse and partner Evolve Bank, Revolut’s record year and more. item.title: Henrik Fisker drops salary to $1 to keep Fisker Inc. bankruptcy case alive
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description:
Fisker Inc. co-founders Henrik Fisker and his wife, Geeta Gupta-Fisker, are lowering their salaries to $1 in order to keep their failed EV startup’s bankruptcy proceedings funded, as lawyers work to complete a sale of its remaining inventory. Fisker Inc.’s restructuring officer, John DiDonato, said in a Tuesday morning filing that the couple, who co-founded […]

item.title: Alexa co-creator gives first glimpse of Unlikely AI’s tech strategy
item.dc:creator: Mike Butcher
item.description:
After announcing a whopping $20 million seed last year, Unlikely AI founder William Tunstall-Pedoe has kept the budding U.K. foundation model maker’s approach under lock and key. Until now: TechCrunch can exclusively reveal Unlikely is taking a “neuro-symbolic” approach to its AI. In an additional development, it’s announcing two senior hires — including the former […]

item.title: TechCrunch Minute: This is what happens when you shoot down a delivery drone
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description:
Florida man is back with a vengeance, and this time, he’s going after Walmart delivery drones.  Yes, really. Walmart was demonstrating its delivery drone technology in Clermont, Florida — about 25 miles outside of Orlando — and a man allegedly shot the drone out of the sky when it flew near his house. Apparently, he […]

item.title: Humane execs leave company to found AI fact-checking startup

Infactory is a kind of fact-checking search engine that will be focused exclusively on data at launch.

item.title: FTC bans NGL from offering its anonymous social app to minors
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description:
In a first, the Federal Trade Commission is banning an app from serving users under the age of 18. The agency announced on Tuesday that it’s banning NGL, an anonymous social app, from marketing or offering its app to minors. NGL will pay $5 million to settle the lawsuit. Launched in 2021, NGL rose to […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Google Maps is rolling out speedometer, speed limits on iPhone and CarPlay globally
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description:
When people start navigation on Google Maps, the vehicle's speed is shown in miles or kilometers, depending on the region.

item.title: Duolingo acquires Detroit-based design studio Hobbes
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
Design and animation are core to the Duolingo experience, which makes learning a new language or skill more like a game rather than a task to be dreaded.

item.title: Facebook keeps asking me to say ‘happy birthday’ to dead people
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description:
Two of my friends died within the last three years. By some coincidence, both of their birthdays fall in the beginning of July. So, twice this week, Facebook has reminded me to write “happy birthday” to two people who will never respond. Facebook’s algorithms can’t comprehend death. All it knows is there was a time […]

item.title: With $6M in seed funding, Enso plans to bring AI agents to SMBs
item.dc:creator: Frederic Lardinois
item.description:
Running a small business means doing more with less. AI agents can help, but building custom agents for specific workflows remains challenging, even with today’s low-code/no-code tools. The idea behind Enso — which came out of stealth by announcing a $6 million seed funding round Tuesday — is to give small and medium-sized businesses (SMBs) […]

item.title: Meet Wayther, an iOS weather forecast app designed specifically for road trips
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description:
A new iOS app called Wayther wants to help you better plan your road trips by giving you real-time road conditions and weather forecasts along your route. Created by indie developer Axel Le Pennec, Wayther gives you weather forecasts along your route up to 10 days in advance.  Le Pennec, who has been building iOS […]

item.title: Chasing YouTube, Spotify adds comments to podcasts
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
The feature puts Spotify in more direct competition with YouTube as a place where creators can interact with their listeners.

item.title: Evolve Bank says ransomware gang stole personal data on millions of customers
item.dc:creator: Carly Page
item.description:
Evolve has confirmed that the personal data of at least 7.6 million people was accessed during LockBit's ransomware attack.

item.title: Etsy adds AI-generated item guidelines in new seller policy
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description:
Etsy has been grappling with an influx of generic “junk” and AI-generated products on its platform. The service revised its seller policy on Tuesday, introducing new labels that clarify whether a seller made, designed, sourced or handpicked an item. This marks the first time it has dealt directly with artificial intelligence in its seller policy, […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Seae Ventures acquires Unseen Capital after founder death
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description:
Seae Ventures is acquiring Unseen Capital after the death of founder Kayode Owens in 2021. The combined firm will continue to invest in healthcare for minorities and underserved populations. Owens, an investor and entrepreneur, launched Unseen Capital to focus on early-stage healthcare companies started by underrepresented founders, in 2020. He raised $30 million but unfortunately […]

item.title: With the latest iOS 18 developer beta, Apple makes flashlight UI more fun
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
Apple released the third developer beta version of iOS 18 on Monday. While there are no major new features like Apple Intelligence in this update, there are some neat design changes. But the new UI for the flashlight takes the cake. The company had already introduced a new way to control True Tone Flashlights on […]

item.title: Ex-Googler joins filmmaker to launch DreamFlare, a studio for AI-generated video
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description:
A startup called DreamFlare AI is emerging from stealth on Tuesday with the goal of helping content creators make and monetize short-form AI-generated content. The company, co-founded by former Google employee Josh Liss and documentary filmmaker Rob Bralver, does not make or sell its own AI technology to create video. Rather, it’s envisioned as a […]

item.title: Nala to use $40M Series A to build B2B payments platform, scale remittance services
item.dc:creator: Annie Njanja
item.description:
Nala, a remittance startup that is now widening its portfolio through a new B2B payments platform, has raised $40 million equity in a rare deal that becomes one of the largest Series A transactions in Africa.  The oversubscribed round was led by San Francisco-based VC firm Acrew Capital, with participation from DST Global, Norrsken22, HOF Capital, […]
